definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known

sentences.english: He disguised these feelings under an enormous bellowing and hurraying.
sentences.chinese: 他用大聲吼叫和喝采掩飾着這些感情。

sentences.english: Now why dost thou cry out aloud?
sentences.chinese: 現在你爲何大聲哭號呢。

sentences.english: The black horse screamed loudly, a cry of fear.
sentences.chinese: 黑駿馬大聲嘶叫起來，那是一種充滿恐懼的叫喊。

sentences.english: Although De Gang can blame the sea aloud, but he is same however ashamed is right Chun Yan.
sentences.chinese: 儘管德綱可以大聲責備大海，但他卻一樣愧對春顏。

sentences.english: The drowning girl shouted for help.
sentences.chinese: 那個溺水的女孩子大聲呼救。

sentences.english: We read books aloud a lot in our family.
sentences.chinese: 咱們的家人常大聲朗誦書。

sentences.english: There was an infant squalling in the back of the church.
sentences.chinese: 有個嬰兒在教堂後部大聲啼哭。

sentences.english: Mrs. Jennings soon appeared, and the note being given her, she read it aloud.
sentences.chinese: 詹寧斯太太很快回來了，一接到信便大聲讀了起來。

sentences.english: If it's a letter from Mary, read it out, Mother.
sentences.chinese: 媽，如果是瑪麗的來信，就大聲念念吧。

sentences.english: The peddler bawled his wares in the street.
sentences.chinese: 爲他們賣的貨物大聲叫賣的人。

sentences.english: Playing music so loudly that it annoys neighbours is antisocial.
sentences.chinese: 大聲放音樂騷擾四鄰是破壞社會安寧。

sentences.english: Try making up the words to one of your favorite songs, and sing it out loud.
sentences.chinese: 記住你最喜歡的歌的歌詞，並大聲的唱出來。

sentences.english: Janie finally cannot resist speaking up, scolding the men.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮最後忍不住，大聲責罵那些男人。

sentences.english: The horse is champing his hay.
Giovanni shouted as soon as he reached her.
sentences.chinese: 喬凡尼一到她的跟前便大聲喊道。

sentences.english: The littlest one was pointing at the television and exclaiming something to her mother.
sentences.chinese: 最小的那個孩子指着電視，對她的媽媽大聲叫着什麼。

definition: first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
one side/either side/on the one hand/on the other hand/doing while
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
